channel.title: My dev journey
channel.description: Recent content on My dev journey

item.title: Git cheat sheet
item.description: Git commands with specific keys ssh-agent bash -c 'ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_github; git clone git@gitRepoUrl' ssh-agent bash -c 'ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_github; git pull' ssh-agent bash -c 'ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_github; git push' Important things to know Private keys should have permission of 600 chmod 0600 ~/private_key

item.title: TDD Case Study with Angular and the polyline tag
item.description: In this post I want to talk about how I encountered a situation where I applied an aspect of Test Driven Development and Clean Code. It lets you write and refactor your code without any fear of breaking it and analyze and philosophise about the usability of functions or components. This post is about creating a component in Angular which should receive a list of x,y-points which will be displayed as a svg polyline html element.

Hi, I am Anton and a full-stack developer with currently these technologies: Angular Java (Spring) Gitlab Docker Kubernetes I began with Angular and Java at my first job and at the end of my first job I gained more knowledge about packaging and deploying the applications with Gitlab, Docker and Kubernetes. The next challenge was to acquire DevOps skills at my next job. My role was halftime full-stack developer and halftime DevOps where I mainly was responsible for monitoring, building pipelines and clarifying incidents.
